data.title: Odisha News Insight
data.text:
Dum Laga Ke Haisha Film gets thumbs up from B-Town

A film that narrates a heart-warming tale of two imperfect people coming together only to find eternal love -- "Dum Laga Ke Haisha" -- has managed to tug at the heartstrings of members of the film fraternity, for staying true to the essence…

Actor Sushant hopes Audience like ‘Detective Byomkesh Bakshy’

Actor Sushant Singh Rajput, who made a successful Bollywood debut with "Kai Po Che", says he has delivered his career's best performance in his forthcoming film "Detective Byomkesh Bakshy!". Talking about the crime thriller, directed by…

‘Dum Laga Ke Haisha’ is quirky, different: Ayushmann

Actor-singer Ayushmann Khurrana, who is gearing up for the release of his upcoming romantic comedy "Dum Laga Ke Haisha", says the movie offers a unique flavour. "'Dum Laga Ke Haisha' is a quirky and different film. I'm playing a simpleton…

Documentary Film by KIIT Students adjudges Best

A Documentary Film entitled "A Journey-Stone Comes Alive” produced by the School of Film and Media Sciences has adjudged as the Best Documentary Film. The School had sent entries to the Shristi Short Film Festival which was organised by C V…

“O Mother” – a Film on AIDS and Motherhood

Pocket Films, known for bringing short films to the forefront, is here with a film titled “O Mother”, an attempt by director Prashant Bhagia to spread awareness about women with AIDS. The mother-child bond is explored through the eyes of an…

Actress Anushka developed Passion for Cinema with ‘PK’

Actress Anushka Sharma, who is currently busy promoting her film "NH 10", credits her films “PK” and “Bombay Velvet” for igniting passion for cinema in her. "Films affect you on a personal level because this is the life you lead - 95…

Dadasaheb Phalke Award winner D. Ramanaidu dies at 79

Renowned Telugu producer D. Ramanaidu, who holds the record of producing films in the maximum number of Indian languages, breathed his last in Hyderabad on Wednesday. The Dadasaheb Phalke Award winner and Padma Bhushan awardee was 79.…

Survival in Film Industry tough, says Jacqueline Fernandez

Conviction and perseverance are two vital elements that can help a person "survive" in the film industry, especially if he or she is an "outsider". Without any "sugar coating", Sri Lankan actress Jacqueline Fernandez who stepped into…

Choreographer Ganesh Acharya gains Weight for ‘Hey Bro’

Actors usually work towards getting a fit physique for their movies, but choreographer-actor Ganesh Acharya says he gained around 30 to 40 kg for his forthcoming film "Hey Bro". "I was 160 kg, and and I gained another 30 to 40 kg for this…
